dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Salix{/it} of the family Salicaceae, the willow family) of trees and shrubs bearing catkins of apetalous flowers and including forms of value for wood, osiers, or tanbark and a few ornamentals

et: Middle English {it}wilghe, wilowe{/it}, from Old English {it}welig{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}wilge{/it} willow
shortdef: any of a genus (Salix of the family Salicaceae, the willow family) of trees and shrubs bearing catkins of apetalous flowers and including forms of value for wood, osiers, or tanbark and a few ornamentals
an object made of willow wood; especially : a cricket bat

dt: {bc}a willow (such as the North American {it}Salix discolor{/it}) having large cylindrical silky catkins

shortdef: a willow (such as the North American Salix discolor) having large cylindrical silky catkins

dt: {bc}an Asian willow ({it}Salix babylonica{/it}) introduced into North America that has slender pendent branches

shortdef: an Asian willow (Salix babylonica) introduced into North America that has slender pendent branches
